Description: Fragment of a carnelian ear- or hair-ring with subtle, angular edges. Small ridges at the outer edge, both ends preserved with a very small distance of 0.14 cm between them, indicating that this was either for a child or it was indeed a hair-ring as the opening is too small otherwise. The opening part is not perpendicular to the ring but slightly askew.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E13.2Y a/b, sealed under L2 cross wall
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
